title.narrative: NUTRITION:HN&WASH (NATIONAL POLICIES)

description.narrative: Increased evidence and policymakers' capacity to (a) formulate and revise policies, guidelines and tools for high impact interventions to address stunting, breastfeeding, micronutrient deficiencies, diet and lifestyles (b) support equitable delivery of quality nutrition services (c) strengthen nutrition surveillance systems, data collection and reporting, and (d) undertake international exchange of relevant policies, guidelines and tools.Â , which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Micronutrients, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, pregnant women and children, particularly the most disadvantaged, increasingly benefit from benefit from equitable national policies, guidelines and tools for, and innovative monitoring and evaluation of, high impact and quality interventions for survival and development.

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Data, research, evaluation, evidence generation, synthesis, and use for prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition
Diet diversity in early childhood (children under 5), includes complementary feeding and MNPs
Maternal nutrition, including information, supplementation and counselling
National multisectoral strategies and plans to prevent stunting (excludes intervention-specific strategies)
Prevention of overweight and obesity in adolescence (10 to 19 years)
Prevention of overweight and obesity in early childhood (children under 5)
Prevention of overweight and obesity in middle childhood (5 to 9 years)
Prevention of undernutrition in middle childhood (5 to 9 years)
Salt iodization and other large-scale food fortification
Technical assistance - Prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition

description.narrative: Development Partner affairs Technical staff services
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Increased evidence and policymakers? capacity to (a) formulate and revise policies, guidelines and tools for high impactinterventions to address stunting, breastfeeding, micronutrient deficiencies, diet and lifestyles; (b) support equitable deliveryof quality nutrition services; (c) strengthen nutrition surveillance systems, data collection and reporting, and (d) undertakeinternational exchange of relevant policies, guidelines and tools.

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the Government to improve infant and young child feeding (IYCF) and preventing the increasing incidence of childhood overweight. UNICEF focused on increasing evidence and awareness on the important role of the food environment on child nutrition status. UNICEF contributed to various guidance documents, including theNational IYCF Core Messages; the updatedChinese Dietary Guideline for Children aged 0-5 months and 6-23 months; and theNational Action Plan on Childhood Obesity Control (2020-2030). Technical and financial support was provided to Beijing’s Shunyi District Government in scaling up the nutrition school project to all 106 schools. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:01/02/2021

title.narrative: Existence of a national management information system that includes disaggregated data on nutrition, including sex-disaggregated data

baseline.value: Internationally standard module on breastfeeding and complementary feeding included in the 2013 China Nutrition and Health Survey (CNHS)

target.value: 2020:At least 3 indicators included in National Health Services Survey and/or National Nutrition Survey

actual.value: 2020:While four indicators have been included in the CNHS, however, they are not included in the routine health information system/national Health Information Management System (HIMS) yet.
